decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2019 Russian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 23 (Change of floor).pdf
decisions.fact: The floor has been changed and is of a different specification.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 34.6 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed floor is of a different specification from the one used during qualifying, the floor was replaced with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate as per Article 34.2. As the floor is a different specification and was changed whilst the car was in parc ferme, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per Article 34.6 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Mercedes (car 44 fuel temperature)
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2019 Singapore Grand Prix - Offence - Mercedes (car 44 fuel temperature).pdf
decisions.fact: The temperature of the fuel intended for immediate use was more than eleven degrees centigrade below the ambient temperature recorded by the FIA appointed weather service provider one hour before the first practice session.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 6.5.2 of the FIA Formula One Technical Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: The competitor (Mercedes AMG Petronas Motorsport) is fined €5,000.
decisions.reason: Per Article 6.5.2 of the 2019 Formula One Technical Regulations, no fuel intended for immediate use in a car may be more than ten degrees centigrade below the ambient temperature. In this case the ambient temperature was published to be 32 degrees centigrade and the temperature of the fuel was at least 11 degrees below. The team representative acknowledged that the temperature was below that required under the Technical Regulations due to an error in setting the temperature. Given that this infringement occurred during Practice 1, we impose the fine set out above.

decisions.fact: A 4th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE), 4th Turbocharger (TC), 4th Motor Generator Unit – Heat (MGU-H), 3rd Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K), 3rd Energy Store (ES) and 3rd Control Electronics (CE) have been used.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 23.3 (a) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the rear of the starting grid.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance to with Article 23.3 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 99 (Race Start)
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2019 German Grand Prix - Offence - Car 99 (Race Start).pdf
decisions.fact: The torque in the clutch at the start did not match the torque demand as the driver released the clutch within the specified 70 millisecond maximum period. This time was measured at approximately 300 milliseconds.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 27.1 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: 10 second stop and go penalty imposed after the race in accordance with Article 38.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. (30 seconds added to elapsed race time).
decisions.reason: Article 27.1 of the Formula One Sporting Regulations specifies that “The Driver must drive the car alone and unaided.” In order to guide the teams as to how they can conform to this regulation, the FIA’s Formula One department has published to the teams a document specifying how each of the various systems that could aid a driver would be regulated.

decisions.offence: Breach of Article 27.1 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: 10 second stop and go penalty imposed after the race in accordance with Article 38.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. (30 seconds added to elapsed race time).

decisions.title: Offence - Car 63 (Change of frong wing assembly)
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2019 Austrian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 63 (Change of frong wing assembly).pdf
decisions.fact: The front wing assembly has been changed while under parc ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 34.2 n) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane and follow the procedure in Article 36.2.
decisions.reason: As the front wing assembly was different to the one used during qualifying, it was replaced with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate after a written request was made, per Article 34.2. As the part was changed while the car was in parc ferme, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per Article 34.6 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 7 - Rear wing assembly
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2021 Brazilian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 7 - Rear wing assembly.pdf
decisions.fact: The rear wing assembly has been changed.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 34.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed rear wing assembly is of a different specification from the one used during qualifying. The part was replaced with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate as per article 34.2. As the rear wing assembly is a different specification and was changed whilst the car was in parc ferme, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per article 34.8 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 44 - DRS
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2021 Brazilian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 44 - DRS.pdf
decisions.fact: Could not fulfil the requirement of a maximum 85mm measurement (adjustable positions of uppermost rear wing element).
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 3.6.3 of the FIA Formula One Technical Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Car 44 is disqualified from the results of qualifying (Art. 12.4.1 m of the FIA International Sporting Code)
decisions.reason: Reason The Technical Delegate reported that Car 44 failed the test designed to check the requirements of the last paragraph of Art. 3.6.3 of the 2021 FIA Formula 1 Technical Regulations. The check is described in Technical Directive 011-19. In lay terms, there is a gap between the upper and lower parts of the rear wing. When the DRS is not activated this gap must be between 10mm and 15mm. The car passed this part of the test. When DRS is activated, which raises the upper element of the wing to a flatter position, the gap must be between 10mm and 85mm. The maximum gap is measured, in accordance with TD/011-19, by pushing an 85mm gauge against the gap with a maximum load of 10N (ten newtons.) If the gauge goes through then the car has failed the test. In this case, the gauge would not pass through at the inner section of the wing, but did at the outer section of the wing. This test was repeated four times with two different gauges, once being done in the presence of

decisions.title: Offence - Car 10 - ES change of specification
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2021 Italian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 10 - ES change of specification.pdf
decisions.fact: The energy store (ES) has been changed.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 34.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed energy store is of a different specification from the one used during qualifying. The part was replaced with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate as per article 34.2. As the energy store is a different specification and was changed whilst the car was in parc ferme, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per article 34.8 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

The rear wing was replaced, changes to the suspension setup and cooling of the front brakes were made with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate as per Article 34.2 As the rear wing is different and changes have been made to the to the suspension setup and front brake cooling whilst the car was in parc ferme, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per Article 34.6 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 22 - Parc Ferme

decisions.fact: The floor has been changed and is of a different specification, changes have also been made to the setup of the suspension.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 34.6 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed floor is of a different specification from the one used during qualifying, the floor was replaced with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate as per Article 34.2. Changes have also been made to the setup of the suspension. As the changed floor is a different specification and changes have been made to the setup of the suspension whilst the car was in parc ferme, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per Article 34.6 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 22 - Changes under Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 Brazilian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 22 - Changes under Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following parts have been replaced and changes to the setup have been made: Floor (same specification) Front Wing/Nose assembly (different specification) Rear Wing (different specification)
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed items were replaced whilst the car was in parc ferme with the approval of the Technical Delegate. The front wing/nose assembly and the rear wing are of a different specification to that which was used previously. Changes have also been made to the setup of the suspension of car 22. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 United States Grand Prix - Offence - Car 31 - Changes under Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit Elements have been used: 6th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 4th Energy Store (ES) 4th Control Electronics (CE)
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed PU elements were replaced whilst the car was in parc ferme without the approval of the Technical Delegate. As the PU elements were changed without approval of the Technical Delegate this is not in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 10 - Changes under Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 Japanese Grand Prix - Offence - Car 10 - Changes under Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The rear wing assembly, front wing ballast and the setup of the suspension have been changed.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed rear wing assembly is of a different specification from the one used during Qualification. The part was replaced with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate as per article 40.3. As the rear wing assembly is a different specification and was changed whilst the car was in parc ferme and the suspension setup has also changed, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 Singapore Grand Prix - Offence - Car 63 - PU elements.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit Elements have been used: 4th Internal Combustion Unit (ICE) 4th Turbo Charger (TC) 4th Motor Generator Unit – Heat (MGU-H) 4th Motor Generator Unit – Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) PU components were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during parc ferme
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Having received a report from the Technical Delegate (Doc 45) the above mentioned changes to the Power Unit Elements have been made to the car. In addition, the PU components were changed while the car was under parc ferme without the permission of the Technical Delegate, in breach of Article 40.3 of the Sporting Regulations. The penalty for such a change is prescribed in 40.9 (b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations and requires the car to start the race from the pit lane.

decisions.decisionText: - Car 22 - Reprimands Description Decision - Car 22 - Reprimands Enclosed ITA DOC 11 - Decision - Car 22 - Reprimands.pdf Garry Connelly Loic Bacquelaine Mika Salo Paolo Longoni -- 1 of 2 -- Garry Connelly Loic Bacquelaine Mika Salo Paolo Longoni The Stewards 2022 I TALIAN GRAND PRIX 08 – 11 September 2022 From The Stewards Document 11 To All Officials, All Teams Date 09 September 2022 Time 12:12 The Stewards have considered the following matter and determine the following: No / Driver 22 – Yuki Tsunoda Competitor Scuderia AlphaTauri Time 11:45 Fact Car 22 accumulated 5 Reprimands during the current Championship Doc 15 - 2022 Bahrain Grand Prix – Driving Doc 31 - 2022 Australian Grand Prix – Driving Doc 60 - 2022 Australian Grand Prix – Driving Doc 22 – 2022 Monaco Grand Prix – Driving Doc 59 – 2022 Dutch Grand Prix – Non-Driving Offence Accumulated 5 Reprimands during the Championship, in accordance with Article 18.1 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Decision Drop of 10 Grid Positions

decisions.title: Offence - Car 22 - PU elements
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 Belgian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 22 - PU elements.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit Elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Unit (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit – Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit – Kinetic (MGU-K) PU components were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during parc ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Having received a report from the Technical Delegate (Doc 60) the above mentioned changes to the Power Unit Elements have been made to the car. In addition, the PU components were changed while the car was under parc ferme without the permission of the Technical Delegate, in breach of Article 40.3 of the Sporting Regulations. The penalty for such a change is prescribed in 40.9 (b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations and requires the car to start the race from the pit lane.

decisions.offence: Accumulated more than 15 grid place penalties under Article 28.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the back of the starting grid.
decisions.reason: As car 16 has accumulated 20 grid place penalties (Documents 14 and 31) for this competition under Article 28.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations, this is in excess of the fifteen permitted under the Regulation and therefore the car will be required to start the race from the back of the starting grid, which will be handled in accordance with Article 42.

decisions.title: Summons - Car 10 - PU Components
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 Hungarian Grand Prix - Summons - Car 10 - PU Components_0.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit Elements have been used: 4th Internal Combustion Unit (ICE) 4th Turbo Charger (TC) 4th Motor Generator Unit – Heat (MGU-H) 4th Motor Generator Unit – Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) PU components were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Having received a report from the Technical Delegate (Document 35) and having heard from the team representatives, we determined that the abovementioned changes to the Power Unit Components were made to the car. In addition, we determined that PU components were changed while the car was under Parc Ferme without the permission of the Technical Delegate, in breach of Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The penalty for such a change is prescribed in 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations and requires the car to start the race from the pit lane.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 77 - Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 Austrian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 77 - Parc Ferme .pdf
decisions.fact: The rear wing assembly and the setup of the suspension has been changed.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed rear wing assembly is of a different specification from the one used during the Sprint. The part was replaced with the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate as per article 40.3. As the rear wing assembly is a different specification and was changed whilst the car was in parc ferme and the suspension setup has also changed, the competitor is required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 24 - Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2022 Emilia Romagna Grand Prix - Offence - Car 24 - Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: Working on the car and carrying out unsupervised work on car 24 under Parc Ferme Conditions.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.6 and 40.9 of FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: The car is required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Car 24 was involved in a collision and suffered significant damage during the Sprint session In repairing Car 24 subsequent to the Sprint session, Car 24 was found to have breached Article 40.6 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations as the car used during the Sprint session was not covered and ready for FIA seals within 2 hours of the Sprint session. Furthermore, in breach of Article 40.9, the Competitor was found to have continued to work on the car unsupervised while under parc ferme conditions. The Competitor admitted that modifications were made to the car. In any event, given the lack of supervision

decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Mexico City Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 14 - Pit Lane Speeding.pdf
decisions.competitor: Aston Martin Aramco Cognizant F1 Team
decisions.fact: Pit lane speeding – 80.1 km/h
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 34.7 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: The competitor (Aston Martin Aramco Cognizant F1 Team) is fined €100.
decisions.reason: Car 14 exceeded the pit lane speed limit which is set at 80 km/h for this event by 0.1 km/h.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 18 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Mexico City Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 18 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.competitor: Aston Martin Aramco Cognizant F1 Team
decisions.fact: The setup of the car has been changed while under Parc Fermé.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The setup of the car was modified whilst the car was in Parc Fermé with the approval of the Technical Delegate. The parts have been changed for a different specification. The car is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane as per article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 22 - PU Elements and RNC Changes
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Mexico City Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 22 - PU Elements and RNC Changes.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) The following Restricted-Number Components have been used: 5th Gearbox Cases and Cassettes (GBX C & C) 5th Gearbox Driveline, Gear Change Components and Auxiliary Components (GBX DL)
decisions.offence: Breach of Articles 28.2 and 29.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the back of the starting grid.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with 28.3, 29.2, 32.4, 32.5 and 42.3 d), noting that during the session the driver of the car was Isack Hadjar.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 16 - Technical non-compliance (Plank)

decisions.fact: The rear skid in the area defined in the Technical Delegate’s report was outside the thresholds outlined in Article 3.5.9 e) of the FIA Formula One Technical Regulations.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 3.5.9 e) of the FIA Formula One Technical Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Car 16 is disqualified from the Race (Art. 12.4.1.m of the FIA International Sporting Code). The other competitors move up in the classification.
decisions.reason: The

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 27 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 United States Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 27 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The setup of the car has been changed while under Parc Fermé.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The setup was modified whilst the car was in Parc Fermé with the approval of the Technical Delegate. The parts have been changed for a different specification. The car is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.competitor: Aston Martin Aramco Cognizant F1 Team
decisions.fact: Failure to enter the pit lane to the left of the white line, contrary to the Race Director’s Event Note (item 14.1, document 16)
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 12.2.1 i) of the International Sporting Code and Appendix L Chapter IV Article 4 d) of that Code.
decisions.decisionText: 5 second time penalty.
decisions.reason: The

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 24 - Changes made during Parc Ferme (PU)
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Singapore Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 24 - Changes made during Parc Ferme (PU).pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) All elements above were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Fermé. The setup of the car has been changed while under Parc Fermé.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with 40.9 The Power Unit elements used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2023 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Art. 28.2 and incurs a grid penalty. As the PU elements were changed without prior approval of the Technical Delegate in Parc Fermé this is not in accordance with Article 40.3 and Art 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 20 - Changes made during Parc Ferme (PU)
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Dutch Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 20 - Changes made during Parc Ferme (PU).pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) The following Restricted-Number Components have been used: 5th Gearbox Cases and Cassettes (GBX C & C) 5th Gearbox Driveline, Gear Change Components and Auxiliary Components (GBX DL) All elements above were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Fermé.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 29.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with 40.9 The Power Unit elements used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2023 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Art. 28.2 and incurs a grid penalty. The RNC components and auxiliary components used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2023 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Art. 29.2 and incurs a grid penalty. As the PU elements and RNC and auxiliary components were changed without prior approval of the Technical Delegate in Parque Fermé this is not in accordance with Article 40.3 and Art 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. -- 1 of 2 --

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 27 - Changes made during Parc Ferme (PU)
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Belgian Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 27 - Changes made during Parc Ferme (PU).pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) The following Restricted-Number Components have been used: 5th Gearbox Cases and Cassettes (GBX C & C) 5th Gearbox Driveline, Gear Change Components and Auxiliary Components (GBX DL) All elements above were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Fermé.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 29.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with 40.9 Power Unit elements in excess of the permitted number for the 2023 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Article 28.2 and incurs a grid penalty. RNC components and auxiliary components in excess of the permitted number for the 2023 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Article 29.2 and incurs a grid penalty. As the PU elements and RNC and auxiliary components were changed without prior approval of the Technical Delegate in Parc Fermé this is not in accordance with -- 1 of 2 --

decisions.title: Decision - Car 22 - Alleged unsafe release
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Austrian Grand Prix - Decision - Car 22 - Alleged unsafe release.pdf
decisions.fact: Alleged failure to serve a penalty during a pit stop.
decisions.offence: Alleged breach of Article 54.4(c) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: No further action.
decisions.reason: Video evidence from the FIA pit box overhead camera shows the jack moving towards the front of the car as the car stops. It appears very close but after the expiration of the 5 second time penalty, there appears to be a small further forward movement leading us to have doubt as to whether the jack was touching the car during the penalty period. In this case the competitor is given the benefit of the doubt.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 21 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Austrian Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 21 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme. The suspension setup has been changed while under Parc Fermé. The rear wing and beam wing have been changed to a different specification than that which was used during qualifying
decisions.offence: Breach of Articles 28.2 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The Power Unit elements have been changed. The setup was modified whilst the car was in parc fermé without the approval of the Technical Delegate. The wing setup has been changed from that previously used in Qualifying. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 20 - Changes made during Parc Ferme

decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.

decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Canadian Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 4 - Unsportsmanlike Behaviour.pdf
decisions.fact: The driver slowed under the Safety Car to avoid a delay during a “double stack” for his pitstop. Infringment Breach of Article 12.2.1.l of the of the FIA International Sporting Code. Decision 5 second time penalty. Reason The Stewards reviewed positioning/marshalling system data, video, timing, telemetry, team radio and in-car video evidence. During the Safety Car period the driver slowed to allow a gap to form between his team mate in Car 81 and him. In doing so he delayed the cars behind. There was a significant difference in speed between Car 4 and Car 81 between Turns 10 and 13 (approximately 50 km/h). Article 12.2.1.l of the ISC refers to “any

decisions.title: Offence - Car 27 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Azerbaijan Grand Prix - Offence - Car 27 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The suspension setup has been changed while under Parc Fermé.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The setup was modified whilst the car was in parc fermé with the approval of the Technical Delegate further to a written request. The suspension setup has been changed from that previously used in the Sprint. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 77 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Australian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 77 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The setup of the suspension has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The setup was modified whilst the car was in parc fermé with the approval of the Technical Delegate further to a written request. The suspension setup has been changed from that previously used in Qualifying. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 c) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Offence - Car 11 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2023 Australian Grand Prix - Offence - Car 11 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used and changes made to suspension while under Parc Ferme. 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 c) and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The changed PU elements were replaced whilst the car was in parc ferme without the approval of the Technical Delegate. Further changes were made to the suspension with the approval of the Technical Delegate. As such this setup is different from what was run in Qualifying. As the PU elements were changed without prior approval of the Technical Delegate this is not in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The competitor is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per article 40.9 c) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.decisionText: 5 second time penalty.

decisions.title: Doc 30 - Infringement - Car 43 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Las Vegas Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 43 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Restricted-Number Components have been used: 6th Gearbox Cases and Cassettes (GBX C & C) 6th Gearbox Driveline, Gear Change Components and Auxiliary Components (GBX DL) The front brake cooling ducts have been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Articles 29.2 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The RNC used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season. This is a breach of Article 29.2 and incurs a grid penalty. Additionally, Williams Racing changed the front brake cooling ducts of Car 43 under Parc Ferme with the approval of the Technical Delegate in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. However, the parts are different from the ones originally used, which is a breach of Article 40.9 and Car 43 is required to start the Race from pit lane. Due to the fact that the car is required to start from the pit lane, the grid penalty does not come into effect.

decisions.title: Doc 61 - Infringement - Car 55 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 São Paulo Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 55 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) The following Restricted-Number Components have been used: 6th Gearbox Cases and Cassettes (GBX C & C) 6th Gearbox Driveline, Gear Change Components and Auxiliary Components (GBX DL) All Power Unit elements and listed components were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Fermé.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 29.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with 40.9. Power Unit elements in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Article 28.2 and incurs a grid penalty. RNC components and auxiliary components in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Article 29.2 and incurs a grid penalty. As the PU elements and RNC and auxiliary components were changed without prior approval of the Technical Delegate in Parc Fermé this is not in accordance with Articles 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Car 55 is therefore required to start the race from the pit lane per Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. -- 1 of 2 --

decisions.fact: The setup of the suspension has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Sprint from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Stake F1 Team Kick Sauber changed the setup of the suspension of Car 24 under Parc Ferme, without the approval of the Technical Delegate. This is not in accordance with Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Car 24 is therefore required to start the Sprint from pit lane.

decisions.title: Doc 36 - Infringement - Car 14 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 São Paulo Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 14 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The bodywork specification and the setup of the suspension has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Sprint from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Aston Martin Aramco F1 Team changed the bodywork specification of Car 14 under Parc Ferme with the approval of the Technical Delegate, this not being in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Also changes have been made to the set-up of the suspension, which is a breach of Article 40.9 and Car 14 is required to start the Sprint from pit lane.

decisions.title: Doc 39 - Infringement - Car 31 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Mexico City Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 31 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The Power Unit elements used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season. This is a breach of Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Further, the parts have been replaced without the approval of the Technical Delegate, this being a breach of Article 40.3. Additionally, Car 31 is required to start the Race from pit lane in accordance with Article 40.9.

decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 4th Energy Store (ES)
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Doc 17 - Infringement - Car 30 - PU elements
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 United States Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 30 - PU elements.pdf
decisions.competitor: Visa Cash App RB F1 Team
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit-Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit-Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE)
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race behind any other classified driver.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 42.3 d). The use of each additional element in this case carries a 10 grid place penalty (ref Article 28.3) in this case there is an accumulation of 60 places. Article 42.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start behind any other classified driver.

decisions.title:
Doc 50 - Infringement - Car 31 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
  

  
  
  
  
  Published on 15.09.24 10:57 CET
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Azerbaijan Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 31 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The Power Unit elements used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season. This is a breach of Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Further, the parts have been replaced without the approval of the Technical Delegate, this being a breach of Article 40.3. Therefore Car 31 is required to start the Race from pit lane in accordance with Article 40.9.

  Published on 14.09.24 11:41 CET
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Azerbaijan Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 24 - PU elements.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE)
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the back of the starting grid.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 28.3. The use of each additional element in this case carries a 10 grid place penalty therefore there is an accumulation of 20 places. Article 42.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start from the back of the grid.

decisions.offence: Breach of Article 4.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: The Super Licence of the driver of Car 20 is suspended for the next Competition of the 2024 FIA Formula One World Championship. Following this suspension, 12 penalty points will be removed.

decisions.title: Doc 18 - Infringement - Car 22 - PU elements
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Belgian Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 22 - PU elements.pdf
decisions.competitor: Visa Cash App RB F1 Team
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE)
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the back of the starting grid.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 28.3. The use of each additional element in this case carries a 10 grid place penalty therefore there is an accumulation of 60 places. Article 42.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start from the back of the grid.

decisions.title: Doc 41 - Infringement - Car 23 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Spanish Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 23 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The Power Unit elements used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season. This is a breach of Article 28.2 and incurs a grid penalty in accordance with Article 28.3. The parts have been replaced without the approval of the Technical Delegate, this being a breach of Article 40.3. Therefore Car 23 is required to start the Race from pit lane in accordance with Article 40.9. Due to the fact that the car is required to start from the Pit Lane, the grid penalty does not come into effect.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 77 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Canadian Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 77 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) The rear wing specification has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The Power Unit elements used are in excess of the permitted number for the 2024 Championship season were used. This is a breach of Art. 28.2 and incurs a grid penalty. Additionally, Stake F1 Team Kick Sauber Team changed the rear wing assembly of Car 77 under Parc Ferme with the approval of the Technical Delegate in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. However, the assembly is of a different specification, which is a breach of Article 40.9 and Car 77 is required to start the Race from pit lane. Due to the fact that the car is required to start from the pit lane, the grid penalty does not come into effect.

decisions.reason: Stake F1 Team Kick Sauber Team changed the rear wing assembly of Car 24 under Parc Ferme with the approval of the Technical Delegate in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. However, the assembly is of a different specification, which is a breach of Article 40.9 and Car 24 is required to start the Race from pit lane.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 44 - Pit Lane Speeding
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Miami Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 44 - Pit Lane Speeding.pdf
decisions.fact: Pit lane speeding – 90.7 km/h
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 34.7 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Drive through penalty. (20 seconds added to elapsed Sprint time).
decisions.reason: Car 44 exceeded the pit lane speed limit which is set at 80 km/h for this event by 10.7 km/h. Per the Penalty Guidelines, the penalty for speeding in the pit lane during a sprint session race by between 6-15km/h is a drive through. This is what we impose. As the drive through penalty was imposed during the last three laps, it will be converted to a 20 second time penalty per Article 54.3 (d) of the Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Infringement - Car 2 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/sites/default/files/decision-document/2024 Chinese Grand Prix - Infringement - Car 2 - Changes made during Parc Ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The front wing/nose assembly, rear wing gurney and setup of the suspension has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Williams Racing changed the front wing/nose assembly and rear wing gurney of Car 2 under Parc Ferme without the approval of the Technical Delegate, this not being in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Also changes have been made to the set-up of the suspension, which is a breach of Article 40.9 and Car 2 is required to start the race from Pit Lane.

decisions.title: Doc 29 - Infringement - Car 18 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_qatar_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_18_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The setup of the suspension has been changed while under Parc Ferme. The Steering rack, Steering column rack and further modifications to the diffuser edge and parameters (associated with the energy management calibration of the PU) were made. Setup of the suspension has also been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Sprint from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Aston Martin Aramco F1 Team changed the Steering rack, Steering column rack and made further modifications to the diffuser edge and parameters (associated with the energy management calibration of the PU) of Car 18 under Parc Ferme without the approval of the Technical Delegate, this not being in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Also changes have been made to the set-up of the suspension, which is a breach of Article 40.9 b). and Car 18 is required to start the Sprint from pit lane.

decisions.title: Doc 43 - Infringement - Car 22 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_las_vegas_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_22_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 6th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 6th Turbo Charger (TC) 6th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 6th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 9th Engine Exhaust System (EX) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme. The rear wing assembly has been changed while under Parc Ferme without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 28.3. The use of each additional element carries a 10 grid place penalty (with the exception of the Engine Exhaust System which carries a 5 grid place penalty) therefore there is an accumulation of 55 places. Article 42.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start from the back of the grid. As the Power Unit elemnts were changed without permission and changes have been made to the set-up of the suspension, therefore Car 22 is required to start the Race from pit lane. In addition, Oracle Red Bull Racing changed the rear wing assembly of Car 22 under Parc Ferme without the approval of the Technical Delegate, this is not in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The assembly is of a different specification, which is a breach of Article 40.9 and Car 22 is required to start the Race from pit lane. -- 1 of 2 --

decisions.title: Doc 56 - Infringement - Car 1 - PU elements and changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_sao_paulo_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_1_-_pu_elements_and_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) All of the above Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme. The setup of the suspension has been changed while under Parc Ferme without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 40.9 b) Oracle Red Bull Racing changed the setup of the suspension of Car 1 under Parc Ferme, this not being in accordance with Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. As the Power Unit elements were changed without permission and changes have been made to the set-up of the suspension, therefore Car 1 is required to start the Race from pit lane.

decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula 1 Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Doc 31 - Infringement - Car 55 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_sao_paulo_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_55_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The setup of the car has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Sprint from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Atlassian Williams Racing changed the setup of Car 55 under Parc Ferme, with the approval of the Technical Delegate. The car is therefore required to start the Sprint from pit lane as per Article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Doc 30 - Infringement - Car 22 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_sao_paulo_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_22_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The setup of the car has been changed while under Parc Ferme. The rear wing specification has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Sprint from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Oracle Red Bull Racing changed the setup of Car 22 under Parc Ferme, with the approval of the Technical Delegate. The car is therefore required to start the Sprint from pit lane as per Article 40.9 b) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Also Oracle Red Bull Racing changed the front wing/nose assembly of Car 22 under Parc Ferme with the approval of the Technical Delegate in accordance with Article 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. However, the assembly is of a different specification, which is a breach of Article 40.9 and Car 22 is required to start the Sprint from pit lane.

decisions.fact: The setup of the suspension has been changed while under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.

decisions.title: Doc 35 - Infringement - Car 10 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_italian_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_10_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The team did not cover Car 10 two hours after the chequered flag of the qualifying session and the following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 7th Engine Exhaust System (EX) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 40.3, 40.6 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 28.3. The 7th Engine Exhaust System (EX) used is one of the eight (8) exhaust systems allowed for the 2025 Championship season and therefore is in conformity with Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The use of the other additional elements carries a 10 place grid penalty for each element used in this case. Therefore there is an accumulation of 40 grid places. Article 42.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start from the back of the grid. However, as the Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate (this being a breach of Article 40.3) and as the team did not cover the car two hours after the chequered flag of qualifying (this being a breach of 40.6), a pit lane start is warranted in accordance with Article 40.9 a) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. -- 1 of 2 --

decisions.title: Doc 34 - Infringement - Car 6 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_italian_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_6_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.competitor: Visa Cash App Racing Bulls F1 Team
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) 7th Engine Exhaust System (EX) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 28.3. The 7th Engine Exhaust System (EX) used is one of the eight (8) exhaust systems allowed for the 2025 Championship season and therefore is in conformity with Article 28.2 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. The use of the other additional elements carries a 10 place grid penalty for each element used in this case. Therefore there is an accumulation of 60 grid places. Article 42.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start from the back of the grid. However, as the Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate (this being a breach of Article 40.3) a pit lane start is warranted in accordance with Article 40.9 a) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. -- 1 of 2 --

decisions.title: Doc 41 - Infringement - Car 87 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_dutch_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_87_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The Team did not cover car 87 two hours after the chequered flag of the qualifying session and the following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) 6th Engine Exhaust System (EX) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 40.6 and 40.9a of the 2025 Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Car 87 is required to start the Race from the pit lane and follow the procedures prescribed in Article 44.2.
decisions.reason: In light of the above facts, the Formula One Sporting Regulations precribe the penalties to be applied for the two breaches. While the penalty for a breach of Article 28.2 is the appropriate number of grid places prescribed by Article 28.3, in this case, because the changes were made without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate and because the competitor made the changes during parc ferme and failed to comply with Article 40.6, the penalty to be applied is the one prescribed by Article 40.9(a), namely a pit lane start. We accordingly imposed the said penalty.

decisions.title: Doc 31 - Infringement - Car 22 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_hungarian_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_22_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme. Also changes have been made to the brake cooling configuration of Car 22 while Car 22 was during Parc Ferme without the approval of the Technical Delegate.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The use of each additional element in this case carries a 10 grid place penalty. Therefore there is an accumulation of 40 places. Further, because the changes to the brake cooling configuration were made while the Car was held under Parc Ferme conditions in breach of Article 40.2 without the approval of the Technical Delegate, in accordance with Article 40.9, Car 22 must start the race from the pit lane and follow the procedures prescribed in Article 44.2.

decisions.title: Doc 60 - Infringement - Car 55 - Changes made during Parc Ferme
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_belgian_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_55_-_changes_made_during_parc_ferme.pdf
decisions.fact: The mechanical and aerodynamic set-up of car number 55 has been changed without the approval of the FIA technical delegate whilst under Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: Atlassian Williams Racing changed the setup of the mechanical and aerodynamic set-up of Car 55 under Parc Ferme, this not being in accordance with Article 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Car 55 is therefore required to start the Race from pit lane in accordance with Article 40.9 b).

decisions.title: Doc 58 - Infringement - Car 44 - PU elements
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_belgian_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_44_-_pu_elements.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) 6th Engine Exhaust System (EX) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2 and 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 28.3. of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations (‘Sporting Regulations’). The use of each additional element in this case carries a 10 grid place penalty therefore there is an accumulation of 60 places. Article 42.3 d) of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start from the back of the grid. However, as components were changed without the permission of the FIA Technical Delegate Car 44 must therefore start the race from the pit lane as specified by Art.40.9 (b).

decisions.title: Doc 49 - Infringement - Car 27 - Pit Lane incident
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_belgian_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_27_-_pit_lane_incident.pdf
decisions.fact: Car 27 attempted to move into the Fast Lane and there was a subsequent collision between it and Car 18.
decisions.offence: - Car 27 - Pit Lane incident Description Infringement - Car 27 - Pit Lane incident Enclosed BEL DOC 49 - Infringement Car 27 - Pit Lane Incident with Car 18 .pdf Garry Connelly Felix Holter Vitantonio Liuzzi Loïc Bacquelaine -- 1 of 3 -- 2025 BELGIAN G RAND PRIX 25 – 27 July 2025 From The Stewards Document 49 To The Team Manager, Date 26 July 2025 Stake F1 Team Kick Sauber Time 18:50 The Stewards, having received a report from the Race Director, summoned (documents 43 & 44) and heard from the drivers and team representatives and the FIA Formula 1 Race Director and FIA Single Seater Sporting Director, have considered the following matter and determine the following: No / Driver: 27 - Nico Hulkenberg Competitor: Kick Sauber F1 Team Time: 16:01 Session: Qualifying Fact: Car 27 attempted to move into the Fast Lane and there was a subsequent collision between it and Car 18. Infringement: Breach of Article 34.8 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. Alleged breach of the FIA International Sporting Code Appendix L Chapter IV Article 2d) – Causing a Collision
decisions.decisionText: 1: Decision 2: Competitor: Reprimand in relation to Breach of Article 34.8 of the Formula 1 Sporting Regulations No Further Action in relation to Causing a Collision
decisions.reason: The

decisions.title: Doc 36 - Infringement - Car 43 - PU Elements (Corrected)
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_british_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_43_-_pu_elements_corrected.pdf
decisions.fact: The following Power Unit elements have been used: 5th Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) 5th Turbo Charger (TC) 5th Motor Generator Unit - Heat (MGU-H) 5th Motor Generator Unit-Kinetic (MGU-K) 3rd Energy Store (ES) 3rd Control Electronics (CE) All Power Unit elements were replaced without the approval of the FIA Technical Delegate during Parc Ferme.
decisions.offence: Breaches of Articles 28.2, 40.3 and 40.9 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Required to start the Race from the pit lane.
decisions.reason: The penalty is imposed in accordance with Article 28.3 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations (‘Sporting Regulations’). The use of each additional element in this case carries a 10 grid place penalty therefore there is an accumulation of 60 places. Article 42.3 d) of the Sporting Regulations provides that a driver which has accrued more than 15 cumulative grid position penalties must start from the back of the grid. However, as components were changed without the permission of the FIA Technical Delegate Car 43 must therefore start the race from the pit lane as specified by Art. 40.9 (a).

decisions.title: Doc 73 - Decision - Red Bull - Protest against Car 63
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_canadian_grand_prix_-_decision_-_red_bull_-_protest_against_car_63.pdf
decisions.competitor: s are reminded that they have the right to appeal certain decisions of the Stewards, in
decisions.fact: that Car 63’s onboard showed the driver looking in his mirrors before he braked that he knew Car 1 was immediately behind and he braked to force Car to overtake to force an
decisions.offence: by Car 1. 11. Red Bull suggested that the driver of Car 63 complained about the overtake on his team radio knowing that it would be overheard by race control and in the hope that Car 1 would be investigated. 12. They also suggested that it must have been obvious to the driver for Car 63 that the race would end under safety car such that it was unnecessary for Car 63 to maintain heat in tyres and brakes. Mercedes’ arguments in defence: 13. The driver of Car 63 explained that: - periodic braking is commonplace and to be expected during safety car deployments to ensure that temperature is maintained in tyres and brakes; - on the back straight he found himself catching the safety car. He pointed to in-car video which showed him gesticulating with his hand which he said was to signal to the safety car driver to speed up; - he braked where he did for two reasons. First to ensure he kept a gap to the safety car. Secondly, to keep temperature in his brakes and tyres; - he looked in his mirrors before he braked to check whether Car 1 was immediately behind and only braked after he saw that Car 1 was to the side; - his telemetry showed that the brake pressure he applied was 30psi which he said was not severe; - the driver of Car 1 ought to have anticipated that he might apply brake to keep heat in his brakes and tyres; - it is not the responsibility of the Car ahead to look out for the following Car in any event; - by pointing out to his team that Car 1 had overtaken he was not intending to provoke an investigation into Car 1; - he did not know that the race would definitely end under safety car. 14. Mercedes submitted that what the driver of Car 63 had said over team radio was nothing other than factual. The team lodged no complaint with race control about the Car overtake because the position was given back by Car 1. 15. Mercedes also tendered telemetry showing brake patterns of both Car 63 and Car 1 on several laps under safety car which they said showed that the driver of Car 1 had been braking on the same straight on other laps under the safety car – which they said showed that what the driver of Car 63 was unremarkable. -- 3 of 4 -- Submissions of the FIA 16. Mr Malyon explained that the incident had been observed by the race control team and assessed to not warrant being reported to the stewards. He said that periodic braking under safety car is typical and to be expected. He said that for this reason, race control always allows a degree of tolerance with respect to the 10 car length rule recognising that there is a need for a reasonable degree of braking and acceleration. Conclusions of the Stewards 17. Having regard to the evidence of Mr Malyon, we accept the driver of Car 63’s explanation of the incident and we are satisfied that the driver of Car 63 did not drive erratically by braking where he did or to the extent he did. 18. We are not satisfied that by simply reporting to his team that Car 1 had overtaken that he engaged in unsportsmanlike conduct. 19. Even though the protest did not allege it, we are also satisfied that by braking where and when he did and to the extent he did, the driver of Car 63 did not engage in unsportsmanlike conduct.
decisions.decisionText: - Red Bull - Protest against Car 63 Description Decision - Red Bull - Protest against Car 63 Enclosed CAN DOC 73 - Protest Decision.pdf Gerd Ennser Matthew Selley Natalie Corsmit Enrique Bernoldi Marcel Demers -- 1 of 4 -- 2025 CANADIAN GRAND PRIX 13 – 15 June 2025 From The Stewards Document 73 To The Team Manager, Date 15 June 2025 Oracle Red Bull Racing Time 21:05 Protest lodged by Oracle Red Bull Racing against Car 63 for allegedly driving erratically under Safety Car and displaying unsportsmanlike behaviour by complaining that Car 1 had overtaken under Safety Car conditions Stewards’ Decision: The Protest is rejected as it is not founded. Procedure 1. On June 15, 2025, following the publication of the Provisional Classification for the Canada Grand Prix, Oracle Red Bull Racing (“Red Bull”) filed a Protest against Car 63 (George Russell) entered by Mercedes-AMG PETRONAS F1 Team (“Mercedes”). Red Bull claimed in its protest that the driver of Car 63 had breached Article 55.5 of the FIA Formula 1 Sporting Regulations by braking unnecessarily and erratically behind the safety car. The protest further alleged that the driver of Car 63 had breached Article 12.2.1m of the FIA International Sporting Code by complaining that the driver of Car 1 had overtaken him under safety car conditions. The parties were summoned and heard. The following persons were present during the hearing: On behalf of Red Bull: Stephen Knowles, Gianpiero Lambiase and the driver of Car 1, Max Verstappen On behalf of Mercedes: Ron Meadows, Andrew Shovlin and the driver of Car 63, George Russell On behalf of the FIA: Tim Malyon and Rui Marques 2. None of the parties objected to the composition of the panel of Stewards. 3. None of the parties requested the hearing of additional persons or requested conducting further investigations. Admissibility 4. The Stewards find that the Protest is admissible as all requirements of Article 13 of the FIA International Sporting Code have been fulfilled. 5. The Hearing of the Protest then proceeded. -- 2 of 4 -- The Claims of Red Bull 6. Red Bull claimed that during a safety car deployment the driver of Car 63 had braked unnecessarily along the back straight between turns 12 and 13 as a result of which Car 1, which was following Car 63, overtook Car 63 and then dropped back behind Car 63 after Car 63 accelerated. 7. Red Bull also alleged that by complaining over team radio that Car 1 had overtaken him under safety car the driver of Car 63 had ‘displayed unsportsmanlike intent’. 8. The driver of Car 1 said that he was taken by surprise by Car 63’s sudden braking on the straight and had no alternative but to overtake Car 63 momentarily. 9. Red Bull tendered telemetry showing the throttle and brake applications of each Car. 10. Red Bull suggested that it could be inferred from the fact that Car 63’s onboard showed the driver looking in his mirrors before he braked that he knew Car 1 was immediately behind and he braked to force Car to overtake to force an infringement by Car 1. 11. Red Bull suggested that the driver of Car 63 complained about the overtake on his team radio knowing that it would be overheard by race control and in the hope that Car 1 would be investigated. 12. They also suggested that it must have been obvious to the driver for Car 63 that the race would end under safety car such that it was unnecessary for Car 63 to maintain heat in tyres and brakes. Mercedes’ arguments in defence: 13. The driver of Car 63 explained that: - periodic braking is commonplace and to be expected during safety car deployments to ensure that temperature is maintained in tyres and brakes; - on the back straight he found himself catching the safety car. He pointed to in-car video which showed him gesticulating with his hand which he said was to signal to the safety car driver to speed up; - he braked where he did for two reasons. First to ensure he kept a gap to the safety car. Secondly, to keep temperature in his brakes and tyres; - he looked in his mirrors before he braked to check whether Car 1 was immediately behind and only braked after he saw that Car 1 was to the side; - his telemetry showed that the brake pressure he applied was 30psi which he said was not severe; - the driver of Car 1 ought to have anticipated that he might apply brake to keep heat in his brakes and tyres; - it is not the responsibility of the Car ahead to look out for the following Car in any event; - by pointing out to his team that Car 1 had overtaken he was not intending to provoke an investigation into Car 1; - he did not know that the race would definitely end under safety car. 14. Mercedes submitted that what the driver of Car 63 had said over team radio was nothing other than factual. The team lodged no complaint with race control about the Car overtake because the position was given back by Car 1. 15. Mercedes also tendered telemetry showing brake patterns of both Car 63 and Car 1 on several laps under safety car which they said showed that the driver of Car 1 had been braking on the same straight on other laps under the safety car – which they said showed that what the driver of Car 63 was unremarkable. -- 3 of 4 -- Submissions of the FIA 16. Mr Malyon explained that the incident had been observed by the race control team and assessed to not warrant being reported to the stewards. He said that periodic braking under safety car is typical and to be expected. He said that for this

decisions.title: Doc 71 - Infringement - Car 10 - Safety Car Procedure
decisions.pdfUrl: https://www.fia.com/system/files/decision-document/2025_canadian_grand_prix_-_infringement_-_car_10_-_safety_car_procedure.pdf
decisions.fact: Overtaking under Safety Car conditions after the chequered flag.
decisions.offence: Breach of Article 55.8 of the 2025 FIA Formula 1 Sporting Regulations.
decisions.decisionText: Driver: Warning.
decisions.reason: The driver overtook other cars after the chequered flag, but while Safety Car signals were still being displayed, following an incident on the start/finish straight involving Car 4 (Lando Norris) and Car 81 (Oscar Piastri). While passing after the chequered flag is not unusual, it is prohibited in the case of yellow flags, Safety Car or Virtual Safety Car procedures. While the drivers were aware of where the incident was, they could not have known if emergency equipment or marshals were being dispatched onto the track, and so have to proceed with caution. We are therefore warning the driver concerned, along with all other competitors. Further breaches may incur higher penalties.

While the drivers were aware of where the incident was, they could not have known if emergency equipment or marshals were being dispatched onto the track, and so have to proceed with caution. We are therefore warning the driver concerned, along with all other competitors. Further breaches may incur higher penalties.
